author: arnetheduck
content: at the time of the merge, the apis and error codes in particular were not well defined and differed wildly between implementations - ditto behavior on parallel  in-flight requests, already-know blocks etc - I haven't checked lately but a classic example was what should happen if you fcu to the "previous" block - rewind the chain? stay with the current head? etc.

author: arnetheduck
content: afair there are still error codes in there which I believe are redundant and/or not implemented the same everywhere, though again, I haven't followed up on this lately

author: arnetheduck
content: this is also why the tool above is so simple - it seeks to not stress any unusual code paths - that said, even `eth_blockNumber` that it relies on isn't defined for the engine api, and in json-rpc it isn't defined with sufficient precision - "latest block number" can be just about anything - ie if the el is processing some blcok (syncing for example), we want it to return the point to which the el is synced but that is not guaranteed

author: arnetheduck
content: in nimbus, we can control this and give `eth_blockNumber` a sufficiently compatible implementation but that doesn't guaranteee the tool works for all el:s
